d.  It  is  common
among Christians to believe that God is a personal being, who created the
universe, and who is omnipotent, omniscient, and perfectly good. Indeed, it
is commonly said that God must possess all perfections.
Yet we observe that the world this perfect being created has many imper-
fections: there is much joy in the world; but there is also much suffering, much
of it apparently undeserved; and there is sin. We call these things evil. How
